cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi ESE of Progreso, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north, accelerate north-northeast across the Gulf, make landfall on the northern Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana–Mississippi coast) late Wednesday, then sweep northeast across the southern Appalachians and Mid-Atlantic, reaching the New Jersey/Mid-Atlantic coast Thursday night before moving offshore.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana to Mississippi coast (near Morgan City–Mississippi/Alabama border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – watches confined to northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge Warnings from Morgan City LA to the MS/AL border; Tropical-Storm Warning MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton Co. FL line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA–FL Panhandle) then inland through AL, GA, the southern Appalachians, Mid-Atlantic states, and southern New England including New Jersey/New York coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<10%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusts 20–30 kt possible Thursday night into Friday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible along the New Jersey shore, NY Harbor, and western Long Island Sound with onshore flow Thursday night.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 5+ inches possible Thursday–Friday, leading to localized flash or urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Poor visibility, rough seas, and strong rip currents; slight coastal flooding during high-tide cycles.
